intro: Stenospermation longipetiolatum, commonly known as the long-petioled stenospermation, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated petioles that support its palmate leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
